articles.title: How Savage and Smethurst gave Macclesfield 'new life'
articles.summary: A look at how former Premier League footballer Robbie Savage and Macclesfield FC owner Rob Smethurst helped revive a football club.

articles.title: Salah in Liverpool squad for Brighton match
articles.summary: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah is in the squad for Saturday's Premier League match against Brighton after talks with head coach Arne Slot on Friday.

articles.title: Palmer's groin problem makes no 'sense' - Maresca
articles.summary: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca says there is "not any sense" to Cole Palmer's ongoing groin injury - and hopes it does not prove to be a season-long issue.

articles.title: Cup final victory would 'validate' Celtic process - Nancy
articles.summary: Celtic manager Wilfried Nancy says victory in Sunday's Premier Sports Cup final against St Mirren would "validate" what he is trying to implement at his new club.

articles.title: Why Dewsbury-Hall is thriving at Everton after Chelsea exit
articles.summary: Midfielder Kiernan Dewsbury-Hall returns to Stamford Bridge on Saturday in outstanding form as Everton look to leapfrog Chelsea in the Premier League.

articles.title: Bronze's 'beautiful' chip features in UWCL goals of the week
articles.summary: Strikes from Lucy Bronze, Linda Caicedo and Melchie Dumornay all feature in the best goals of the week from the Women's Champions League.

articles.title: Daly scores in 27 seconds as Villa put three past Liverpool
articles.summary: Rachel Daly scores her first two goals of the season, including one in the first 27 seconds of the match, as Aston Villa beat Liverpool 3-0 in the Women's Super League.

articles.title: 'There can only be one singer' - my secrets of successful man-management
articles.summary: In his BBC Sport column, ex-Premier League boss Tony Pulis looks at man-management and how dealing with unhappy players is not the only challenge a manager will face.

articles.title: All your FPL stats and Premier League team news in one place
articles.summary: Every key bit of Premier League team news and the most important Fantasy Premier League statistics - all in one place.

articles.title: BBC to show Macclesfield and Spurs FA Cup ties
articles.summary: Non-league Macclesfield's FA Cup third round tie with holders Crystal Palace will be televised live on BBC One on Saturday, 10 January (12:15 GMT kick-off).

articles.title: Six players to watch at Afcon 2025
articles.summary: BBC Sport Africa picks out six players to keep an eye on at the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations in Morocco from 21 December to 18 January.

articles.title: Rangers v Hibs, Braga & Martindale in focus
articles.summary: Monday's meeting between Rangers and Hibernian, Heart of Midlothian's Claudio Braga and Livingston manager David Martindale provide talking points in the Scottish Premiership this weekend.

articles.title: Is Saka an alternative to Haaland as captain? The FPL talking point
articles.summary: With Premier League leaders Arsenal hosting bottom club Wolves, is it time to captain Bukayo Saka in your fantasy football team? Our FPL experts give their views.

articles.title: 'Nancy exposed to brutal life as Celtic manager as cup final looms'
articles.summary: BBC Scotland's chief sportswriter, Tom English, dissects Wilfried Nancy's start as Celtic manager with the Premier Sports Cup final looming.

articles.title: Football Daily
articles.summary: Ian Dennis, Ali Bruce-Ball & Conor McNamara chat Salah, Premier League & language.

articles.title: Lampard wins second manager of the month award
articles.summary: Coventry City boss Frank Lampard is named the Championship's manager of the month for November with striker Ellis Simms winning the player award.

articles.title: Van Veen battles to first World Championship win as seed Smith knocked out
articles.summary: Gian van Veen survived a scare against Cristo Reyes to pick up a 3-1 win at Alexandra Palace, his first victory in the World Darts Championship at the third time of asking.

articles.title: Byrne inspires Leinster to Champions Cup win at Leicester
articles.summary: Harry Byrne's goal-kicking proved the difference as an error-strewn Leinster held off a determined Leicester to claim a 23-15 victory in the Investec Champions Cup.

articles.title: Christmas has come early! Evans in EPIC festive entrance
articles.summary: Ricky Evans came out to Merry Christmas Everyone by Shakin' Stevens for his World Darts Championship opener.
